speaker: MAN #1
line: Dave says he would set it up in the Carsell's village.

speaker: MAN #2
line: Yeah, well, Dave's a stand-up guy. If he's putting it together, you'd be a fool to pass it up.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Yeah, yeah, I hear you. I just...

speaker: MAN #2
line: You just what?

speaker: MAN #1
line: When you want to take a dip, you got to test the water. You just don't want to get wet.

speaker: MAN #2
line: No, man. Dippage is sacred.

speaker: BRISENTINE
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: BRISENTINE
line: You're being relieved from your current assignment. Agent Bozoff will take over. You've got a flight to catch in forty-five minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where am I going?

speaker: BRISENTINE
line: Murder case. Newark, New Jersey.

speaker: MULDER
line: Treat yourself.

speaker: BRISENTINE
line: You're flying out of National. Your contact in Newark is Detective Norman.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did I draw the assignment?

speaker: BRISENTINE
line: Assistant Director Skinner made the request.

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinner requested me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder, F.B.I.

speaker: NORMAN
line: My forensics team's just wrapping up. We left the body where we found it. Kenny! This is one case I'm going to be happy to turn over to you guys. Watch yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, wouldn't want to step in anything.

speaker: NORMAN
line: They say it cuts the smell if you don't breathe through your mouth.

speaker: MULDER
line: They lied. Who found the body?

speaker: NORMAN
line: Sanitation worker. Looks like it's been here a while.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any I.D.?

speaker: NORMAN
line: No. Not much to go on either. Front side of the body is pretty much eaten away. Would you like us to turn him over for you?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'll take your word on that.

speaker: NORMAN
line: Hey, Agent Mulder. What would you like us to do with the body?

speaker: MULDER
line: Wrap it up and send it to the F.B.I., care of Assistant Director Skinner.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to speak to him.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: I'm sorry, Mister Skinner's unavailable. Would you like to take a seat?

speaker: MULDER
line: Will you tell him that I'm here and I need to speak with him? Now.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Certainly. Excuse me, Mister Skinner. I'm very sorry to interrupt, but Agent Mulder is demanding to see you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is there a problem, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, there is.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then make an appointment.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's kind of hard to make an appointment when you're up to your ass in raw sewage, being jerked around from one meaningless assignment to another.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Excuse me?

speaker: MULDER
line: What's my next punishment, scrubbing the bathroom floors with a toothbrush?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're way out of line, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: So I gathered.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Fine. Come into my office, Agent Mulder, please. Agent Mulder, would you please inform the room as to why you regard your homicide case in New Jersey as meaningless?

speaker: MULDER
line: It seemed to me like a simple drugland body dump, not the type of case the F.B.I. normally wastes it's time and manpower on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Certainly, Agent Mulder, given your recent history here, you're not one to judge what is or is not a waste of the bureau's time or manpower.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir, my work on the X-Files...

speaker: SKINNER
line: The X-Files have been closed, Agent Mulder. You will carry out your new assignments and investigate them to the best of your ability. Is that not clear?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And I'll be anticipating your field reports on your current homicide case. Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this seat taken?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. But I should warn you, I'm experiencing violent impulses.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm armed, so I'll take my chances. I hear you really endeared yourself to Assistant Director Skinner today.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, sometimes, it just gets really hard to smile through it when they ask you to bend down and grab your ankles. You know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not exactly as if you've ever tried to fit into the program.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. No, I've been thinking a lot about that lately. I've been thinking about leaving.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The bureau? What would you do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Pursue my work in the paranormal somehow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Y, you could request a transfer to Quantico. Come back to the Behavioral Science Unit.

speaker: MULDER
line: They don't want us working together, Scully... and right now, that's the only reason I can think of to stay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wh, what about this case you're working on?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a zero.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's the body?

speaker: MULDER
line: They transferred it to our forensics lab. Look, Scully, I know what you're trying to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe I can request to do the autopsy.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's an exercise. Skinner is just rubbing my nose in this one. There's nothing to it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a dead body, isn't there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Examination and autopsy of John Doe number one-zero-one-three-five-six. Case number D-P-one-one-two-one-four-eight. Special Agent Fox Mulder, field investigator. Body is an adult male, with advanced tissue decomposition, weighing a hundred and sixty-five pounds in extremis, sixty-nine inches in length. Intact skin is mottled and discolored, due to submergence in and exposure to a highly bacterial environment. Cause and time of death unknown. Possible identifying mark on right forearm. Body cavities appear normal. Interior organs intact. Consistent in rate of decomposition. Removing the rib cage. Condition of heart and lungs are good. No sign of thrombi, natural degenerate diseases, indicate victim was probably a young adult. The liver shows some nodular hardening, consistent with incipient alcoholism. Oh, God!

speaker: WORKMAN #2
line: Put it away.

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: Got it. I'm going to need a big piece of thirty gauge and some bailing wire.

speaker: WORKMAN #2
line: I got to go back up top for the screen.

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: Hey! Help!

speaker: WORKMAN #2
line: Craig! Craig! Craig! Craig! Hey, Craig! Hold on! Craig! Craig! Hold on, man! Hold on! Oh, my God! Hold on! Hold on! Oh my God. I'm going to get help!

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: I'm going to give you a tetanus booster just as a precaution.

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: I'd be happy if you'd just give me something to get this taste out of my mouth.

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: Oh, yeah? Let me take a look. "Aaaah." Any trouble swallowing?

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: Uh-uh.

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: It'll go away. Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: New York P.D. referred me to you. I was surprised to hear the F.B.I. was involved. Is there something here I should know?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, maybe you can tell me.

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: The patient is a sanitation worker. He claims he was attacked by something down in the sewer this morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Attacked? By what?

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: We've been unable to determine. Initially, I thought it was just a disability claim... but he appears to be telling the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's his condition?

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: He's in satisfactory health. I've given him a heavy course of antibiotics... and we're checking for hepatitis. He does have a strange wound on his back.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of wound?

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: Uh, it could be some kind of bacterial infection. Frankly, I can't say I've ever seen anything like it. This is Agent Mulder of the F.B.I.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea what attacked you?

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: Yeah, I've been thinking it might have been a python.

speaker: MULDER
line: A python?

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: Yeah, or a boa constrictor. Somebody probably flushed a pet snake down the toilet. I found an alligator in the sewer a couple of years ago. It was stronger than hell, I'll tell you that, clamped onto me like a vise.

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: It almost looks like a bite.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, excuse me. Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I need to see you, I've got something here I think you should know about.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Some kind of parasite near John Doe. I'm having it looked at, but I should know more by the time you get down here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I'm up in Jersey. I should be taking the shuttle down in about an hour.

speaker: WORKMAN #1
line: When can I get out of here? I'd just like to go home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, excuse me, sorry. Scully, this is a bad time for me to talk.

speaker: X
line: Mister Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: X
line: I think you should know... you have a friend at the F.B.I.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who is this?

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: ZENZOLA
line: If you don't have any more questions, I'm going to release this man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, go ahead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Close the door. It's called Turbellaria, or it's commonly known as a fluke or flatworm.

speaker: MULDER
line: This was living inside the body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apparently, it had attached itself to the bile duct and was feeding off the liver.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lovely.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Believe it or not, something like forty million people are infected worldwide.

speaker: MULDER
line: This isn't where you tell me some terrible story about sushi, is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe you'd rather hear what you can catch from a nice, rare steak.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, what, the murder weapon was a top sirloin?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Flukes are endemic in unsanitary conditions. It's more likely that the victim contracted it down inside the sewer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Before or after he died?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. According to my sources, it's unlikely that a single parasite could have killed him. He was a young man. But the weird thing is, there's no other discernible cause of death.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do these parasites attach themselves?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They have what's called a scolex... it's a sucker-like mouth with four hooking spikes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything like this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where'd you get that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Something attacked a workman in a New Jersey sewer this morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you're asking me if this is from a fluke?

speaker: MULDER
line: Could it be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: M, Mulder, the scolex is a tiny little organ. This is a huge bite mark.

speaker: MULDER
line: How big can these things get?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I... I'm sorry. It felt like old times there for a second. Flatworms are what are known as obligate endoparasites. They live inside the host, entering the body through the ingestion of larvae or eggs. They are not creatures that go around attacking people.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's good. I didn't want to have to tell Skinner that his murder suspect was a giant, blood-sucking worm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, at the very least, this will be interesting to the Newark Department of Sanitation. Look, Scully, I don't know who you shared our conversation with the other night, but I'd prefer if you didn't try to launch a campaign for me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know who you talked to...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't talk to anybody.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, somebody called me and told me I had a friend at the F.B.I.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, Mulder, I... I don't know what to say, but I, I, I wouldn't betray a confidence.

speaker: FOREMAN
line: City runs on several different systems... some new, some built around the turn of the century. Almost as old as Charlie here. Isn't that right, Charlie?

speaker: CHARLIE
line: Oh, yes, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: What part of the sewer was I in?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: That'd be one of the older sections, big eight-foot tunnels.

speaker: MULDER
line: They look more like a catacomb than a sewer line.

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Yup, all the new sections are concrete pipe, not much of it bigger than twenty-four inches.

speaker: MULDER
line: And all the sewage comes through this plant?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Five-hundred-and-sixty thousand people a day call my office on the porcelain telephone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever seen one of these?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Looks like a big, old worm.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's called a fluke. It came from the body they pulled out of the sewer.

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Wouldn't surprise me. No telling what's been breeding down there in the last hundred years. Ray here. Yeah. Charlie, slow down.

speaker: CHARLIE
line: I'm backflushing the system. It's in there.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: CHARLIE
line: I don't know. It just swam right past me. There it is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The turbellarian flatworms are free-living carnivorous scavengers, usually less than three centimeters in length, found in fresh and sea water. They are hermaphroditic with complex reproductive systems, capable of internal fertilization. Many species require more than one host to complete a life cycle. Although the shape of the wound on the sanitation worker suggest scolex attachment, the sheer size of the wound precludes involvement of the common flukeworm. Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, it's me. You know that fluke you caught?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: It must have been the runt of the litter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't see it.

speaker: MULDER
line: There it is. Tucked away in the far corner, behind the pipes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know if you can see it from here, but it has no sex organs. It's genderless.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Platyhelminthis are often hermaphroditic. Mulder, this is amazing. It's vestigial features appear to be parasitic, but it has primate physiology. Where the hell did it come from?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but it looks like I'm going to have to tell Skinner that his suspect is a giant, blood-sucking worm after all. The only thing we're missing is the identity of the body in the sewer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was a Russian. An engineer on a cargo freighter. He had a tattoo on his forearm. I didn't make the connection until I detected that that was the name "Dmitri" spelled in Cyrillic lettering.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you make the connection at all?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Somebody shoved this under my door. I guess you really do have a friend in the F.B.I. And, Mulder... when you see Skinner to hand in your field report, I know that it's your decision, but I hope that you know that I'd consider it more than a professional loss if you decided to leave.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Everything looks in order. Is something wrong, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's just an unexpected response, considering the bizarre nature of the case... and of the suspect.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The strangeness of the criminal and the crime are not lost on me. I had my reaction to them this morning in my conversation with the federal prosecutor's office about how to process the suspect. This meeting... is to evaluate your work.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's no way you'll prosecute this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The justice department has asked that the suspect be transferred to an institution for a full psychiatric evaluation.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is not a man. It's a monster. You can't put it in an institution.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then what do you do with it, Agent Mulder, put it in a zoo? It killed two people.

speaker: MULDER
line: Two?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The sanitation worker who was attacked was found dead in his home as a result of his injuries.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, you had a pair of agents that could have handled a case like this. Agent Scully and I might have been able to save that man's life, but you shut us down.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I know. This should have been an X-File. We all take our orders from someone, Agent Mulder. That'll be all.

speaker: MAN
line: It's secure.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Charlie twenty-one, Charlie twenty-one, what's your E.T.A.? Unit twenty, no further assist needed. They have the suspect in custody from the, uh...

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: This is vehicle forty-nine forty, requesting immediate back-up and assistance.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Roger forty-nine forty, roger forty-nine forty.

speaker: LAKE BETTY PARK; 5
line: 27 am

speaker: LAKE BETTY PARK; 6
line: 37 am

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you got?

speaker: NORMAN
line: Well, we got a dead Marshall and an escaped prisoner. Other than that, we got bubkis. We got a police line in a two-mile radius.

speaker: MULDER
line: Watch all the storm drains, any access to the sewer system. It's going to try to get back underground. Mulder.

speaker: X
line: Mister Mulder, I will make this brief. Success in your current assignment is imperative.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who am I speaking to?

speaker: X
line: Are you hearing me, Mister Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. Why is it imperative?

speaker: X
line: Reinstatement of the X-Files must be undeniable.

speaker: MAN
line: K-nine, unit six-four, copy?

speaker: NORMAN
line: Six-four, copy.

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah, we're at a campsite approximately a quarter-mile from your position. Dogs tracked a scent to a chemical toilet here. Thought he might be hiding inside, but it's empty.

speaker: MULDER
line: The tanker.

speaker: NORMAN
line: Hold on, six-four. What?

speaker: MULDER
line: What if he's on the tanker truck?

speaker: NEWARK COUNTY; SEWAGE PROCESSING PLANT; 8
line: 15 am

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Company that owns the truck you're looking for doesn't keep detailed service records. They had about five trucks out in that area this morning. Three of them have already deposited their loads.

speaker: MULDER
line: So he could have already been here and gone?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: If he hasn't, he will be.

speaker: MULDER
line: And every tanker dumps it's load here?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: It's a state law.

speaker: MULDER
line: Everything is processed through this plant?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Yup.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what happens to it?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Empties through an outlet pipe about five miles out to sea.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could this thing have escaped through that outlet pipe?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Doubtful. The system's full of enough filters and screens that nothing much bigger than your little finger's going to get through. If it's here... it's going to be trapped here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Guess all we can do is wait. Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's me, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm at the treatment plant. I was playing a hunch it might have gotten back into the system.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: Forget it, it's stupid.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you're not going to like what I have to tell you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It hadn't occurred to me, but I think that the fluke in the corpse might have been an incubating larva. This... creature, or whatever it is... Is transmitting it's eggs or larvae through it's bite.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean it's trying to reproduce?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's looking for hosts. It attacks because the victims' bodies provide generative nourishment. Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah...

speaker: SCULLY
line: If it finds a new host...

speaker: MULDER
line: I know, Scully. It could multiply.

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Agent Mulder! Linesman spotting something down in a section of pipe!

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Here.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's near where we found the first body.

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Right, except this is an old overflow system that dumps into the harbor during heavy rainfall.

speaker: MULDER
line: That must be where it got into the system. It's working it's way back out to sea. Mmm...

speaker: FOREMAN
line: That's the overflow pipe. It leads to another vault like this one, then it goes three-quarters of a mile to the sea.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's see if we can get that gate closed.

speaker: FOREMAN
line: It's rusted in position! See if I can get some leverage here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey!

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Aw, damn it!

speaker: MULDER
line: You all right?

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Yeah, I lost my... ah! Help! Help!

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me your hand!

speaker: FOREMAN
line: Get me out of here! Get me out of here! Grab it!

speaker: MULDER
line: We need some help down here! Hey! I'll get you out of here! Hold on! Hold on! You all right? You all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this seat taken?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. But I should warn you, I may reek a bit out of the sewer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll take my chances. You talked to Skinner yesterday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Success in our work is imperative, Scully. Reinstatement of the X-Files must be undeniable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That came from Skinner?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. We have a friend in the F.B.I.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought you might be interested in the lab results on the biology of the fluke larva. Dissection and analysis indicates reproductive and physiological cross-traiting, resulting in a sort quasi-vertebrate human.

speaker: MULDER
line: Human?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, but still capable of spontaneous regeneration, like any fluke or flatworm.

speaker: MULDER
line: How does that happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Radiation. Abnormal cell fusion. The suppression of natural genetic processes. Mulder, nature didn't make this thing. We did.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know these. These are from Chernobyl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That creature came off of a decommissioned Russian freighter that was used in the disposal of salvage material from the meltdown. It was born in a... in a primordial soup of radioactive sewage.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, they say three species disappear off the planet every day. You wonder how many new ones are being created.
